newsitem.title: FRANCE: SIDO sees 5 pct fall in French 97 sunflower crop.
newsitem.headline: SIDO sees 5 pct fall in French 97 sunflower crop.

text.p: The French oilseeds and protein seeds association SIDO predicted on Friday that the 1997 sunflower crop may decline by five percent to 1.9 million tonnes from two million in 1996.
In its first estimate for the 1997/98 season, SIDO said total area sown to sunflower would decline three percent to 890,000 hectares and yields ease to 2.13 tonnes from 2.2 tonnes last year.
The amount of set-aside land used for growing sunflowers for industrial use was expected to rise 17 percent to 41,000 hectares.
SIDO expects crushings to ease four percent to 1.5 million tonnes and exports to decline to 650,000 tonnes from 730,000 tonnes.
Carryover stocks at end June 1998 were expected to be 173,000 tonnes against 283,000 tonnes at end June 1997.
